languageKey.label: Defines operation mode of the plugin
"Comment listing" mode shows list of comments. "Comment form" mode shows form to enter comments.

Defines a parameter in URL that will trigger comments displaying. Typically it is a parameter that defines a single view. For example, tt_news extension uses tx_ttnews[tt_news] as a parameter to define single item to show. Therefore external prefix is tx_ttnews in this case.

To comment on pages, use "pages" prefix.
Defines where to store comment records

Defines file path to the template file. Default points to the extension. Usual TYPO3 fules apply: to specify file in fileadmin, start file path from "fileadmin/", to specify file in another extension, use "EXT:" prefix.
Defines how many comments per page to show
Defines how many comments per page to show
Defines a period after which commenting is closed

Period is defined by an integer number followed by suffix. Suffix can be h, m, y or d (meaning hours, months, years or days respectively). Example: 5d (means close commenting after 5 days). If empty, comments can be added at any moment.
Enables comment ratings
This works only if "ratings" extension is installed.
If checked, every message will require to be approved by moderator. Moderator will receive e-mail with message content and links to approve or delete comment.
If checked, comments will not be approved unless referer matches current site

It is not safe to use this option because many browsers are not reliable in sending referer (and they are not really required to). Also many firewalls block this field. Use only if you are really paranoid about it.
Require captcha to be submitted together with comment.
EXT:comments/csh/captcha.png
Example of captcha in the comment form
Defines the e-mail address to which notifications about new unapproved comments are sent.
Defines the e-mail address from which e-mails are sent.
Defines template to use for e-mail. Usual TYPO3 fules apply: to specify file in fileadmin, start file path from "fileadmin/", to specify file in another extension, use "EXT:" prefix.
